title: Randi Rhodes Show - Jan 29 2010
description:
Friday, January 29, 2010

Mostly I think theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re worried that Obama might do something about it. I think they actually like it. Republicans are like little kids who just canÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t let go of their deficit balloon. The worse shape the government is in, the more Republicans can run against government. So they managed to get every Senate Republican to toe the line. Bottom line: Republicans have a lot more party discipline than they have fiscal discipline.


Also yesterday, the Senate voted to increase the national debt limit by another $1.9 trillion.  ThatÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s rightÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½on the very same day that all 40 Republicans voted against the paygo plan. But I guess Senate Republicans have developed immunity to irony. What exactly is the message from Republicans here? TheyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re refusing to let us stop spendingÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½and theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re refusing to let us pay our bills at the same time! The Republicans arenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t against spendingÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re just against paying. And what was their reasoningÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ or should I say what was their excuse? Republicans generally opposed the paygo rules as a recipe for tax increases. They seem to prefer a recipe for disaster. The total national debt is now $14.3 trillion. To put that number in perspectiveÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s $14.3 trillion! The national debt works out to an incredible $45,000 for every person in this country. Pretty soon the only option weÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll have will be to leave the country. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œI donÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t have $45,000. I guess I have to move to a creditor nation.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll be kind of like when a foreclosed-upon homeowner sends the keys to the house back to the bank. WeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll have to mail the keys to America to the Chinese. Already the government has to borrow 40 cents of every dollar is spends. WeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re spending almost as much of ChinaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s money as we are of our own. With borrowing like this, pretty soon the Chinese will be able to tell us what to do.
